g.text: KERNEL-USERSPACE BOUNDARY — ring 0 vs ring 3 | copy_to/from_user exception-table bridge
M1 | build-kernel-module-m1 | Hello World LKM: Kbuild, printk, module_param, ELF sections
M2 | build-kernel-module-m2 | Char Device: alloc_chrdev_region, cdev, file_operations, copy_user
M3 | build-kernel-module-m3 | ioctl + /proc: shared ABI header, seq_file, CLEAR/RESIZE/STATUS
M4 | build-kernel-module-m4 | Concurrency: mutex, wait_queue, O_NONBLOCK, poll/epoll integration
Total: 4 bytes (one int, one cache word)
Total: ~32 KB .ko (stripped), ~16 KB after init freed
Total: 24B — fits in ONE 64B cache line
64 × 64B cache lines | full L1 friendly sequential I/O
kernel direct-map region | virt = phys + PAGE_OFFSET
GFP_KERNEL can sleep | use GFP_ATOMIC in IRQ context

// Kernel-internal, shown for tracing only struct file *filp; // per-open-fd state loff_t f_pos; // per-fd read position unsigned int f_flags; // O_RDWR | O_NONBLOCK void *private_data; // driver's per-fd ptr
char* | printk KERN_INFO | ring buf entry
struct file_operations | registers | vtable of 7 fn ptrs
fn ptr table | VFS vtable dispatch | f_op->read(filp,...)
char __user* | syscall boundary | buf ptr from userspace
void* | safe copy | 64B chunk to kernel buf
64B | cache line fill | rep movsb or SIMD
struct mydev_status | fills 24B | copy_to_user outside mutex
struct task_struct | context switch | ~2-4µs, CR3 swap
int fd, char* | syscall instruction | ring 0 entry
struct mydev_status | ioctl MYDEV_STATUS fills | 24B out
struct defs | owned by | module instances
handler fns | exposed via | VFS dispatch
